page.title: 07Alderwasley
page.content: The original part of the vicarage at Alderwasley was built in the 16th century and the new part in 1893. In the garden at the back of the vicarage about 12 years ago the present owners found a box containing silver coin clippings dating back to Elizabeth 1,Charles 1 and James 1 time. It is believed highwaymen were responsible for hiding the clippings, which are now in Derby Museum. Alderwasley Hall was first built for the Hurts Family.They owned nearly all the land around.It is now privately owned and used as a Boarding School for children with a speech problem. All Saints Church was built in 1850 by the Hurts and was a private chapel.It was for the family and servants.In 1930 the villagers bought it and now it is used by the village.
